channel.title: 'Javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command
channel.description:
Hi i Have downloaded a new source and i've been trying to get it running on my laptop.
MY classpath is [code].;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;%CLASSPATH%; [/code]
and my path is [code]C:\Program Files\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkSDK\Bin\;C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio .NET\Common7\IDE\;C:\WINDOWS\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v1.0.3705\;C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio .NET\Vc7\bin\;%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\QuickTime\QTSystem\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;c:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Tools\Binn\;c:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\100\DTS\Binn\[/code]
and when i run or compile i get this error [code]'javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command[/code]

item.title: 'Javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @mad_moparscapian mad_moparscapian
item.description:
@mad_moparscapian wrote:

I think i’ve fixed it now MY RSBot works so i’ll assume my server does

Read full topic
item.source: 'Javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command

item.title: 'Javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

[quote=“epicmike, post:3, topic:292157”]Did you set Enviromental variables? follow this tut for more info. All Credits go to “Sick of Air”

Step 1:
Ok, first we have to set the variables. Click on your Start Menu, then Control Panel, then System, then Advances, And finally Environmental Variables.

So, in short:
Start Menu – Control Panel – System – Advanced – Environmental Variables.

Step 2:
Ok, now look for the variable named “path” in the list that is shown. Rename it “PATH” and then replace its variable value with this:
Code:

c:\Windows\System32;”C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\

Step 3:
Now make a new variable and name it “classpath.” Add this for its value:
Code:

C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\

Ok, now that you have your variables set, we need to edit the runserver.bat and compile.bat.

Step 4:
Ok, right-click on your compile.bat and click edit. Now replace everything in it with this:
Code:

@echo off
title Compiler
“%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Step 5:
Ok, now right-click on you runserver.bat and click edit. Now replace everything in it with this:
Code:

@echo off
title Runserver
set java=“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe”
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
pause[/quote]

Yes he set his variables its in his post at the beginning…
That would not work anyway cause you did not tell him to change the last number in the jdk location to his current version.

@Mad

MAKE SURE You are making these variables in USER variables not SYSTEM.

Read full topic
item.source: 'Javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command

item.title: 'Javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @epicmike epicmike
item.description:
@epicmike wrote:

Did you set Enviromental variables? follow this tut for more info. All Credits go to “Sick of Air”

Step 1:
Ok, first we have to set the variables. Click on your Start Menu, then Control Panel, then System, then Advances, And finally Environmental Variables.

So, in short:
Start Menu – Control Panel – System – Advanced – Environmental Variables.

Step 2:
Ok, now look for the variable named “path” in the list that is shown. Rename it “PATH” and then replace its variable value with this:
Code:

c:\Windows\System32;”C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\

Step 3:
Now make a new variable and name it “classpath.” Add this for its value:
Code:

C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\

Ok, now that you have your variables set, we need to edit the runserver.bat and compile.bat.

Step 4:
Ok, right-click on your compile.bat and click edit. Now replace everything in it with this:
Code:

@echo off
title Compiler
“%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Step 5:
Ok, now right-click on you runserver.bat and click edit. Now replace everything in it with this:
Code:

@echo off
title Runserver
set java=“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe”
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
pause

item.title: 'Javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

You need to change the last number where your java is located to your current version of the jdk.

For example your Class path is

\jdk1.6.0_16\

Change that 16 to your current version which is probably 14

And your Path is

\jdk1.6.0_14\

Read full topic
item.source: 'Javac' is not recognised as an internal or external command
